location: England, Buckinghamshire, Stoke Mandeville, Saint Mary's Church
description: A Roman period mausoleum with a Norman church built on top of it, now abandoned. This entry is only here due to possibility it may have been a temple-mausoleum, like those at Lullingstone. With further research this entry may be removed
bibliography: Sherwood, H., (29/10/2021), ‘Astounding’ Roman statues unearthed at Norman church ruins on route of HS2, available at: https://www.theguardian.com/science/2021/oct/29/astounding-roman-statues-unearthed-at-norman-church-ruins-on-route-of-hs2?CMP=Share_iOSApp_Other
